title: (Condensed?) French book serif font
content:
This is from an 1878 edition of _Le tour de France par deux enfants_. I’ve had a go at identifying it, but without a definite result. I haven’t seen any font that has a baseline J and the same Q...and then there’s the ?

Maybe this will be obvious to a more practised eye.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [p014 text sample.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419151133/http:/typophile.com/files/p014%20text%20sample.jpg) | 252.91 KB |
author: seanos

comments.content:
Don't have my refs at hand so this is from memory. Q looks similar to one of the Didots. So would be worthwhile checking them for matches. Not a lot of digital versions of condensed Didots. Perhaps in an old specimen book?  
Don

Looking at the Encyclopedia of Typefaces by Jaspert, Berry and Johnson it is close to french Round Face by Monotype and Serie No. 16 by Deberny & Peignot, but these are later I think, and less condensed.

I suspect you would find a match in a pre 1900 D&P specimen book. Unfortunately none online to my recollection.  
Don

I have a font called Industrial736 from Bitstream that is very similar to this. [Here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419151133/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/DubielPlain) is also another called Dubiel that you can download for free.
